summary: An internal FBI email chain from January 2025 discussing a referral from the SDNY regarding an individual allegedly falsely claiming to be an Epstein victim to receive settlement funds. The email seeks to verify if this individual was identified in the FBI's C-20 Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Supervisory Special Agent
persons.context: The sender of the initial email inquiry, from the FBI New York Division C-3, Complex Financial Crimes squad, seeking information about an individual in relation to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: FBI Email Inquiry on Potential Fraudulent Victim Claim
events.description: An FBI Supervisory Special Agent emails colleagues to inquire about an individual who is allegedly falsely claiming to be an Epstein victim to receive funds from a class-action settlement administered by SDNY.

keyFacts: The document is an FBI email from January 2025, indicating ongoing post-conviction investigative activity related to the Epstein case.
It references a referral from the SDNY regarding an individual allegedly making false claims of being an Epstein victim to obtain settlement funds.
The email seeks to cross-reference the individual's name with the FBI's 'C-20' Epstein investigation files.
The correspondence shows coordination between FBI squads (C-20 and C-3) and the SDNY regarding victim verification and potential fraud.
